channel.title: Ottawa COVID-19 Projections on Ottawa COVID19
channel.description: Recent content in Ottawa COVID-19 Projections on Ottawa COVID19

item.title: Model parameters
item.description: Projections are based on the reported daily hospital census for Ottawa. Daily hospital use reported by Ottawa Public Health. Model parameters other than Ottawa hospital use are aligned with other models. Model parameters are described below. Parameter estimates are from COVID-19-MC and Tuite, Fisman, et al. models where possible, with updates based on Verity et al. (Lancet, March 20, 2020)* and Ferguson et al.

Model use There are two main uses of the projections: Short-term projections (2 to 4 weeks) to inform the immediate need for hospital and critical care services for COVID-19 patients. Long-term projections (6 weeks onward) to assess the effect of relaxing physical distancing. Model accuracy Creating accurate, long-range projections to predict the spread COVID-19 is difficult. It’s akin to forecasting when a hurricane will make landfall when it is still thousands of kilometers out at sea.

item.title: Changelog
item.description: Updates involving only data updates will no longer be documented. V3.0.0 2020-10-05 Case data & projections have been added to the website. See model for more details on how projections for cases were created including input parameters. Ventilator & peak projections removed from website. Death figure removed from website. V2.3.0 2020-08-05 Projections use OPH hospitalization data from 07/07/2020 onwards. Updates to definitions. V2.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Media contact: Michaela Schreiter, Media Relations Officer, The Ottawa Hospital, mschreiter@toh.ca ph: 613-222-7674 Science contacts: Doug Manuel dmanuel@ohri.ca, Warsame Yusuf waryusuf@ohri.ca, Alan Forster Acknowledgements for website and content: Warsame Yusuf, Rostyslav Vyuha, Yulric Sequeira, Andrew Fitches, and others on Big Life Lab team. Supporting Ottawa Public Health epidemiologists: Amira Ali, Jacqueline Willmore, Dara Spatz Attribution: COVID-19 icons made by surang from www.flaticon.com.

item.title: Ottawa COVID-19 Case Projections
item.description: Dashboard Data to 2020-10-05 Current 806 active cases in Ottawa. 26 confirmed COVID-19 patients in hospital. Including: 21 acute care patients. 5 ICU patients. Definitions Hospital census is the count of patients in all Ottawa hospitals at midnight on the previous day. Transmission is the risk that a person becomes infected when they come in contact with a person with COVID-19.

item.title: Ottawa covid-19 wastewater surveillance
item.description: The National Capital Region is one of the first communities in Canada to conduct daily wastewater readings to help inform its community response in the fight against COVID-19, thanks to innovative research from the CHEO Research Institute (CHEO RI) and the University of Ottawa (uOttawa). The figures below were created by researchers at CHEO RI and uOttawa. Learn more about wastewater epidemiology and its role in covid-19 surveillance on Ottawa Public Health’s website.

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: The main purpose of this site is to visualize Ottawa-based projections for models performed by other teams. Review and update model parameters based on recent published studies. Priories for review: ventilated patients deaths
